N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4230.1 - Purpose

State Regulations

These regulations set forth the application process, eligibility requirements and procedure for the administration by the
corporation of the minority and women-owned business development and lending
program authorized and to be funded from the appropriation set forth in the
appropriating legislation. The purpose of the program is to provide financial
assistance to minority and women-owned business enterprises in the State as
well as to projects and programs that assist the development of
entrepreneurship among minority persons and women in the State. To these ends, the corporation is authorized to establish the following programs and to
provide the following forms of assistance: (a) In order to establish a program in
conjunction with locally, community, and regionally based entities to
decentralize lending for small loans and loans to start up minority and
women-owned business enterprises (the decentralized lending program), the
corporation: (1)
may make linked deposits of
funds into eligible banking organizations in order to encourage such
organizations to make small loans to minority and/or women-owned business
enterprises; and
(2)
shall
establish minority and women revolving loan trust fund accounts and related
administrative expense trust fund accounts. (b) In order to establish a comprehensive
program for certified government contractors and eligible government
contractors, the corporation may provide contractor development assistance
through government contractor loans, government contractor loan guarantees, government contractor bonding assistance and government contractor technical
assistance. (c) In order to
establish a program to provide direct financial assistance, the corporation may
provide: (1)
business development loans to
established minority and women-owned business enterprises and business
development loan guarantees to eligible banking organizations proposing to lend
to such enterprises; (2)
franchise
loans to minority and women-owned business enterprises seeking to acquire or
expand a franchise; and
(3)
franchise loan guarantees to eligible banking organizations proposing to lend
to such enterprises. (d) In order to establish a program to create incubator facilities to assist small
and high risk minority and women-owned business enterprises to grow and
prosper, the corporation may provide incubator assistance to eligible incubator
sponsors proposing to undertake an eligible incubator project. (e) In order to establish a comprehensive
technical assistance program to assist minority and women-owned business
enterprises and individuals, the corporation may provide technical assistance
to eligible technical assistance recipients directly and through eligible
technical assistance providers. Notes
